image.altText: A man with a white beard, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the death in custody of a Darwin prisoner has heard prison officers ignored concerns about the "comatose" man being placed alone in a cell.

title.children: NT coroner hears medical concerns brushed aside before death in custody

image.altText: The crest of the Katherine Town Council on a wall, showing the motif of a gorge.

props.synopsis: Dozens of council workers in the Top End town of Katherine could be set to receive thousands of dollars in back pay, after the Fair Work Commission found in their favour.

title.children: 'Wage theft': Katherine Town Council ordered to pay back workers

image.altText: An aerial shot of a solar farm, with panels lining the property.

props.synopsis: An ambitious outback solar project backed by billionaire Mike Cannon-Brookes could soon grow even bigger.

title.children: Huge outback solar provider SunCable looks to expand

image.altText: A large white building with a sign out the front that reads: SUPREME COURT

props.synopsis: In sentencing the man to life behind bars on Friday, the Northern Territory Supreme Court's highest judge described the victim's death as a "profound tragedy".

title.children: Man who killed his wife in front of their child sentenced to life in prison

image.altText: firefighters on the tarmac

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia says all 180 passengers aboard flight VA454 were able to disembark as normal.

title.children: Fire sparks on plane moments after landing in Brisbane, inbound from Darwin

image.altText: Close up of middle-aged man looking past camera

props.synopsis: The announcement comes six months after the ABC first reported the Northern Territory Racing and Wagering Commission chair had accepted corporate hospitality from bookmakers.

title.children: Gambling regulator stops accepting gifts from betting companies, for now

image.altText: A close-up shot of an Indigenous woman speaking, she has dark hair and is wearing lipstick.

props.synopsis: Leanne Liddle knows what it takes to cut it as a police officer, but says tackling racism within the ranks has been her toughest assignment yet.

title.children: Police anti-racism strategy architect describes 'hardest job' of her life

image.altText: Four women embrace and smile. They're surrounded by other people.

props.synopsis: Zohran Mamdani's victory in Tuesday's New York City mayoral election looked unlikely at one point. Polling shows it was women who helped power him into office.

title.children: Mamdani gave these women 'a glimmer of hope'. They helped make him mayor

image.altText: Several men stand on a golf course looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: Golf has a reputation for being expensive and exclusive — but on this island in Bass Strait, things are a bit more relaxed.

title.children: Is this the most relaxed golf course in the country?

image.altText: A serious-looking man in a suit and glasses.

props.synopsis: Ahead of meetings to agree on a Liberal climate policy, the leading moderate says his party must retain a focus on achieving net zero better than Labor.

title.children: Bragg says ditching net zero 'too silly for words' as Liberals play semantics

image.altText: image of several people at a gate with protest signs and a building sign-posted 'Bisalloy Steel' in the background

props.synopsis: Bisalloy Steel's Unanderra site has been the target of multiple pro-Palestine pickets, and has defended its trade with "several Israeli" companies during its 2025 annual general meeting.

title.children: Steel maker defends Israeli trade amid ongoing pro-Palestine protests

image.altText: Gough Whitlam speaks into microphone on steps of Parliament House after the dismissal

props.synopsis: Before Gough Whitlam's dismissal and famous speech on the steps of Parliament House, there was silence — and strategy — in the Senate. This is the inside story of how a budget stand-off changed Australian democracy forever.

title.children: A whispered secret, poker faces, then Gough Whitlam's fate was sealed

image.altText: A loaded container ship sails off from a container terminal across calm blue waters.

props.synopsis: IMF economists say inflation-targeting central banks did not achieve better outcomes than others following the 2022 surge.

title.children: IMF economists say inflation targeting hasn't performed brilliantly in recent years

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair in a white jumper lies under a pink blanket with her hands resting on her stomach.

props.synopsis: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful health care system built around "Caucasian male biology" is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

title.children: 'Difficult reading': Victoria releases report into women's pain

image.altText: A copy of Teen Vogue.

props.synopsis: One of publisher Condé Nast's most acclaimed stories this year came from Teen Vogue. Now, it is shuttering the youth publication — and laying off the staff involved.

title.children: Teen Vogue is closing. It's a magazine we are 'all worse off without'

image.altText: Damage to the outside of a brown apartment building after an air strike.

props.synopsis: A Russian drone slams into an apartment building in eastern Ukraine, killing three people, while another is killed at an energy site, Ukrainian authorities report.

title.children: Russian drone and missile barrage in eastern Ukraine kills four

image.altText: Monty Ioane celebrates with Italy teammates.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies slump to consecutive defeats on their spring tour, as Italy comes from behind to win in Udine.

title.children: Italy completes second-half comeback to beat sloppy Wallabies

image.altText: A women holds an armful of wool in a shearing shed.

props.synopsis: Parisian-born UN photographer Martine Perret turns her lens to capture the resilience and strength of women in rural Australia.

title.children: UN photographer turns lens on women of rural Australia

image.altText: A man leads a Samoan rugby league team in a war dance

props.synopsis: The passion of the Pacific shines through in Samoa's rugby league team, and the pride the people have is evident on the island.

title.children: Pancakes, pride and passion as Samoa creates rugby league magic

image.altText: F1 driver in the paddock, wearing a polo shirt and cap

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri will start on the second row of the grid for Monday's São Paulo Grand Prix. after crashing earlier in the sprint race and losing more ground to Lando Norris in the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

title.children: Piastri qualifies fourth in Brazil after crashing in sprint race

image.altText: Elena Rybakina of Kazakhstan poses with the Billie Jean King trophy, with pyrotechnics and confetti

props.synopsis: Elena Rybakina has defeated world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the season-ending WTA Finals, 6-3, 7-6(0).

title.children: Rybakina stuns Sabalenka to win record $8 million in WTA Finals

image.altText: The Princess of Wales attended the festival with her 12-year-old son Prince George.

props.synopsis: The Prince made his debut at the event, marking an important step toward his future role as king-in-waiting.

title.children: Prince George joins the King, Queen and Princess of Wales at Festival of Remembrance

image.altText: A young woman with glasses puts her arms on top of cabinet

props.synopsis: From late next month, the University of Adelaide and the University of South Australia will begin to cease operations and transform to become Adelaide University. But as the clock ticks, some students and staff are feeling the pressure.

title.children: Students, teaching staff face challenges amid Adelaide University merger

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: I applaud your courage for having a go. That's about it, though.

title.children: Will you get lucky and ace this week's quiz? I wouldn't bet on it

image.altText: A group of about 60 men in dark clothes stand outside a government building with a banner that reads "Abolish the Jewish Lobby".

props.synopsis: A neo-Nazi rally outside the NSW parliament on Saturday morning was deemed "authorised" because police had chosen not to oppose the public assembly.

title.children: Neo-Nazi rally outside NSW parliament allowed to go ahead by police

image.altText: A close up of a little boy smiling

props.synopsis: When Skye Scott took her son to a paediatrician, she never imagined he would be diagnosed with the life-changing Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

title.children: The rare genetic disorder shortening the life span of boys

image.altText: A woman in a strapless ballgown closes her eyes and lifts her head as confetti falls from the ceiling.

props.synopsis: After reading Die My Love in book club, Martin Scorsese knew it had to be made into a film. Now it's rewriting cinema portrayal of womanhood and postpartum depression.

title.children: The movie Jennifer Lawrence (and Martin Scorsese) had to get made

image.altText: A man with glasses half smiles.

props.synopsis: Five deceased Israeli hostages are yet to be returned as part of the ceasefire agreement with Hamas.

title.children: Israel identifies latest hostage body, as families await five more

image.altText: Train tracks running through a rural town

props.synopsis: Police say the one-year-old girl was playing with other children when she was clipped by a freight train near Narrabri, on the New South Wales north-western slopes.

title.children: Police say toddler was playing when fatally struck by a train

image.altText: Clasped hands on a table with a cup of coffee nearby

props.synopsis: Research shows political differences are increasingly impacting relationships. Share your story here.

title.children: Are political differences impacting your relationship? Share your story

image.altText: Man stands in front of large mural painted on wall.

props.synopsis: After making the switch from stonemason to artist four years ago, Callum Hotham's distinctive artworks are reinventing his home town.

title.children: Tradie-turned-artist resurrects 'dead' city centre with murals

image.altText: A bronze statue of a woman stands on a city street

props.synopsis: Joy, a sculpture by artist Loui May, was erected in Sydney's Darlinghurst in the late 1990s. After hundreds signed a petition for its return, a bronze version was created and placed in the spot it once stood decades ago.

title.children: World's first sex worker statue returns home after 30 years

image.altText: A large smoke plume illuminated in bright orange rising above trees and power poles at dusk, while cars have bright lights on.

props.synopsis: The US firms say they are grounding their fleets of McDonnell Douglas MD-11 planes "out of an abundance of caution" after 14 people were killed earlier this week.

title.children: UPS and FedEx ground MD-11 cargo planes after deadly Kentucky crash

image.altText: A waterfront village that has been ravaged by a severe storm.

props.synopsis: Typhoon Kalmaegi left hundreds dead and as Filipinos are bracing for more extreme conditions as they mourn their loved ones and pick up the pieces.

title.children: Philippines braces for another typhoon amid devastation of Kalmaegi

image.altText: Sarah Ferguson and Andrew Mountbatten Windsor at Ascot races in 2015.

props.synopsis: From selling access to Andrew for £500,000 to dodgy dealings with Jeffrey Esptein, Sarah Ferguson has been creating headlines for all the wrong reasons for three decades.

title.children: As Andrew is banished, experts say Fergie could be 'the great Houdini'
